_description: Typography Configuration - Controls all font families, sizes, weights, line heights, and letter spacing. Changes take effect after page reload.
_fontFamily_info: Font stacks for different text types. System fonts load instantly and look native on each platform

fontFamily._primary: Main font stack using system fonts. Falls back gracefully: Apple devices use SF Pro, Windows uses Segoe UI, others use Roboto or sans-serif
fontFamily.primary: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'SF Pro Display', 'Segoe UI', Roboto, sans-serif
fontFamily._monospace: Fixed-width font for code or technical text. Uses system monospace font

_fontSize_info: Font sizes in pixels. Smaller numbers = smaller text. Used throughout the app for consistent sizing

fontSize._xs: Extra small (10px). Used: Mini button numbers, crossfader labels
fontSize._sm: Small (11px). Used: Secondary labels, helper text
fontSize._base: Base/default size (12px). Used: Body text, standard UI text
fontSize._xl: Extra large (18px). Used: Tap to Load button
fontSize._xxl: Extra extra large (20px). Used: Page titles, hero text

_fontWeight_info: Font weights control text thickness. 100=thin, 400=normal, 700=bold, 900=black. Common weights: 400 (normal), 500 (medium), 600 (semibold), 700 (bold)

fontWeight._normal: Normal/regular weight (400). Used: Body text, standard UI
fontWeight._medium: Medium weight (500). Used: Slightly emphasized text
fontWeight._semibold: Semibold weight (600). Used: Headings, important labels
fontWeight._bold: Bold weight (700). Used: Tap to Load button, strong emphasis

_lineHeight_info: Line height controls vertical spacing between lines of text. 1.0 = no extra space, 1.5 = 50% extra space. Affects readability

lineHeight._tight: Tight spacing (1.2). Used: Compact layouts, UI labels
lineHeight._normal: Normal spacing (1.5). Used: Body text, readable paragraphs
lineHeight._relaxed: Relaxed spacing (1.75). Used: Large text, easy reading

_letterSpacing_info: Letter spacing (tracking) controls horizontal space between characters. Negative = tighter, positive = looser. Uses em units (relative to font size)

letterSpacing._tight: Tight tracking (-0.02em). Used: Large headings, compact text
letterSpacing._normal: Normal tracking (0). Used: Most text, default spacing
letterSpacing._wide: Wide tracking (0.05em). Used: Small caps, button text
letterSpacing._wider: Extra wide tracking (0.1em). Used: Spaced out headings, emphasis
